title: Mer de Glace streaks home to win the $5million Caulfield Cup in Melbourne
text:
Mer de Glace broke clear of the field in the home straight to streak through and win Melbourne's $5million Caulfield Cup.

The Japanese import stayed strong to beat out the domestic competition as jockey Damian Lane guided it to victory.

The much-vaunted stallion claimed its first victory on Australian soil and sixth consecutive race win in the process.

Scroll down for video

Mer de Glace has defied the bookies to streak home and win Melbourne 's $5million Caulfield Cup

The $8 runner cruised home ahead of Vow and Declare and Mirage Dancer after sitting back for much of the 5.15pm race before powering through to win.

Lane said while his winning racehorse may be unassuming, Mer de Glace packed a punch.

'He's not much to look at but he's just a tradesman. He just keeps turning up and winning,' he said.

'Not many horses win five on the bounce in Japan because they are all weight for age races so they go up steep every time.

The highly-vaunted import (pictured riding to victory in foreground) claimed its first victory on Australian soil and sixth consecutive race win in the process

'I'm just so rapt he's done the job for everyone today.'

Trainer Hisashi Shimizu admitted he was concerned when the horse lagged at the back of the field for much of the race.

'I was a little bit worried but I had huge faith in the horse and the jockey so I believed in them - it's a great feeling,' he said according to the Herald Sun.

The $8 runner (pictured leading field) cruised home ahead of Vow and Declare and Mirage Dancer after sitting back for much of the 5.15pm race before powering through to win

Trainer Hisashi Shimizu admitted he was concerned when the horse lagged at the back of the field for much of the race

It came after Yes Yes Yes claimed victory at The Everest at Royal Randwick earlier on Saturday and claimed the $14million first prize for taking out the world's richest turf horse race.

The three-year-old colt was one of the outsiders in the elite field of sprinters assembled at the Sydney racecourse.

It dashed clear of the early leaders soon after straightening and held off the late closers Santa Ana Lane and Trekking - which took the minor placings.
description: Mer de Glace broke clear of the field in the home straight to win the  Caulfield Cup in front of local Melbourne stayer Vow and Declare.
authors: Charlie Coë For Daily Mail Australia
